intro: Melampyrum yezoense, commonly known as the Yezo touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
